_examples._note: These are example tool definitions. Copy them to conversation_tools or game_event_tools and customize.

conversation_tool_example.name: Give Item
conversation_tool_example.description: Give an item from the NPC's inventory to the player. Use when rewarding, trading, or gifting.

item_id.description: Unique identifier of the item to give

reason.description: Why the NPC is giving this item

conversation_tools_more_examples.name: Exit Conversation
conversation_tools_more_examples.description: End the current conversation. Use when conversation reaches natural end or NPC wants to leave.

conversation_tools_more_examples.name: Refuse Service
conversation_tools_more_examples.description: Decline to help or provide information. Use for inappropriate requests or insufficient trust.

alternative.description: Suggestion for what the player could try instead

conversation_tools_more_examples.name: Call Security
conversation_tools_more_examples.description: Alert guards or security. Use when feeling threatened or witnessing violations.

game_event_tool_example.name: Receive Gift
game_event_tool_example.description: Called when the player gives this NPC a gift. Affects mood and relationship based on gift value and appropriateness.

item_id.description: The unique identifier of the received item

value.description: Approximate monetary value of the item

is_appropriate.description: Whether this is an appropriate gift for this NPC

game_event_tools_more_examples.name: Time of Day Change
game_event_tools_more_examples.description: Called when game time period changes (morning/afternoon/evening/night). NPC may need to change location.

game_event_tools_more_examples.name: Witness Crime
game_event_tools_more_examples.description: Called when NPC witnesses a crime. May affect trust and trigger reactions.

game_event_tools_more_examples.name: Unlock Door
game_event_tools_more_examples.description: Grant access to a restricted area. Called when NPC opens a door for the player.
